author: Special Correspondent
text:
Move suspended as model code of conduct for Assembly elections came into force on Friday

Resettlement of residents along waterways has been suspended, owing to the model code of conduct coming into force, officials said.

The model code of conduct for Assembly elections came into force on Friday.

The Greater Chennai Corporation has been clearing encroachments along the Adyar river for the past few weeks.

A number of houses have been removed to widen the river.

“Now that the Assembly election process has kicked off, resettlement process will resume after elections. As of now, 12 slums have been completely relocated,” an official said.

9,000 families

identified

Following the floods that brought much destruction to the city in December last year, the civic body identified around 9,000 families along the Adyar river for resettlement.

But officials have been able to evict only 4,100 families along the river in the past few weeks.

Width of river

“After the eviction, the maximum width of the river has crossed 200 metres at many spots, the official said.

The drastic reduction in the width of the river over the years was among the most important reasons for flooding, officials added.

title: Resettlement comes to a halt
